thread.title: Outlast 2 won't be banned in Australia after all
thread.title_full: Outlast 2 won't be banned in Australia after all

title: Outlast 2 won't be banned in Australia after all
text:
Outlast 2 won't be banned in Australia after all Ratings board changes its mind, without any edits.   24/03/2017 
Last week we reported that Outlast 2 would be banned from sale in Australia , as the country's ratings board deemed the game's "implied sexual violence" too upsetting for even its most mature rating, R18+. Games cannot legally be sold in Australia without a rating. 
But now, upon further analysis, the Australian Classification Board has changed its mind and the game is listed with an R18+ rating . 
In the new listing Outlast 2 rates as "high impact" (the most mature level) for sex, violence and "themes". It's only "strong impact" for language and nudity, however. And drug use is merely rated as a "moderate impact". 
Developer Red Barrels issued a statement to Press Start clarifying that the game was not altered in any way to achieve this rating. 
"Outlast 2 has been rated R18+ by the Classification Branch in Australia and will be released 26th April 2017. There will be only one version of Outlast 2 available worldwide," the studio said. 
Outside of Australia, the game will launch one day earlier on 25th April for PS4, Xbox One, and PC.
